{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMERS ALLEGE UNAUTHORIZED TRADING AND UNSUITABLE INVESTMENTS WITH RESPECT TO THEIR TRUSTS ASSETS AND SEEK DAMAGES EXCEEDING $480,000. REPRESENTATIVE MAINTAINS THAT INVESTMENTS WERE SUITABLE AND THAT CUSTOMERS AGREED WITH AND RATIFIED ALL TRADES IN THEIR ACCOUNTS AND WITH THE INVESTMENT STRATEGY FOR THOSE ACCOUNTS.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$482,900.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$86,500.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "99-02474",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE COMPLAINT WAS SETTLED OUTSIDE OF ARBITRATION WITH NO ADMISSION OF WRONG DOING.  THE INVESTMENT STRATEGY WAS ACTUALLY DICTATED BY THE CLIENT WHO INSISTED THE ACCOUNT BE MANAGED MORE AGGRESSIVELY AND INCLUDE INDIVIDUAL STOCKS.  THE REPRESENTATIVE WAS AT RISK, HOWEVER, BECAUSE HE DID NOT UPDATE THE ACCOUNT GAOLS AS LISTED ON THE CLIENT PROFILE TO REFLECT THE MORE AGGRESSIVE NATURE LATER REQUESTED BY THE CLIENT. SOME STOCK TRADES WERE MADE WITHOUT FIRST DISCUSSING THE SPECIFICS WITH THE CLIENT, ALTHOUGH THEY WERE WITHIN THE OVERALL INVESTMENT STRATEGY DISCUSSED WITH THE CLIENT AND WERE NOT RESCINDED BY THE CLIENT ONCE THEY WERE MADE AWARE BY SUBSEQUENT PHONE CALL OR CONFIRMATION.  THE NET EFFECT OF SUCH TRADES WAS POSITIVE.  THE INJUSTICE IS THAT THE REPRESENTATIVE WAS HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY SUCH LOSSES WHILE SIMILAR GAINS WERE IGNORED."
}
